title: Excessive Agency
description: Excessive agency occurs when the LLM has too much autonomy and can perform actions without proper authorization or human oversight. This can lead to unauthorized actions, privilege escalation, or unintended consequences from autonomous LLM decisions.
detection_patterns: LLM can perform critical actions autonomously
LLM can modify system state without validation
No action confirmation for sensitive operations

mitigations.description: Implement human oversight for critical actions
mitigations.implementation: Require human approval for sensitive operations, implement confirmation workflows, and maintain audit logs of all LLM actions.
Grant LLM only minimum required permissions, restrict access to sensitive resources, and implement role-based access control.
Implement action validation, use allowlists for permitted actions, and verify action context before execution.
Log all LLM actions, decisions, and outcomes for security monitoring and incident response.

references.title: OWASP LLM Top 10 - LLM08: Excessive Agency
